programme.title: Victim to Verdict: Doomsday Cult Mom
programme.sub-title: Victim to Verdict: Doomsday Cult Mom
programme.desc: When Lori Vallow's children go missing, she moves to Hawaii and marries cult leader Chad Daybell, leaving behind a path of destruction and several dead bodies in her wake.

programme.title: Victim to Verdict: Movie Popcorn Murder
programme.sub-title: Victim to Verdict: Movie Popcorn Murder
programme.desc: A Sunday afternoon movie date turns deadly when a confrontation over a cell phone and a bag of popcorn ends with a gunshot and retired police captain Curtis Reeves claims he acted in self-defense.

programme.title: Victim to Verdict: Christmas Parade Rampage
programme.sub-title: Victim to Verdict: Christmas Parade Rampage
programme.desc: The annual Christmas parade in Waukesha, Wis., is struck by tragedy when Darrel Brooks drives his SUV through the parade route; the tragedy turns into a spectacle when Brooks decides to represent himself at trial.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.sub-title: Officer Identifies Brooks as the Driver
programme.desc: Darrell Brooks asks the police officer on the stand if he is getting paid to testify; the officer states he was off-duty during the parade when he watched the SUV ram through the crowd.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.sub-title: More Off-Duty Officers From the Parade
programme.desc: An officer testifies about seeing the driver of the SUV jump out of the car and run away.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: The officer who called 911 about a hit-and-run the day of the deadly parade crash identified Darrell Brooks as the driver; according to police, 61 people were injured and six died that day.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: The officer who was working traffic control at the Christmas parade remembered firing at the driver of the red SUV to try to stop him. Six people taking part in the parade died.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: Darrell Brooks has more questions for one of the many police officers who worked the Christmas parade; one officer identified Darrell Brooks as being responsible.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: Jurors heard from the police officer who identified the abandoned red SUV which was damaged after the deadly parade crash. Police claimed that Darrell Brooks was the one who drove it into the parade crowd killing six people and injuring sixty-one.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.sub-title: Judge Halts Court So Brooks Can Rant
programme.desc: The cross-examination of the patrol officer on the stand went in a wildly different direction with Darrell Brooks's questioning. He ranted about not having a quote plaintiff in this case.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: Jurors hear the timeline of events following the deadly parade crash; police claim that after Brooks drove a Ford Escape registered to his mother into the parade crowd, he abandoned the car and ran away.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Stipulations from written statements and court testimony took over trial proceedings.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Scott Nelson's father was allegedly very abusive with the whole family when he was growing up. Testifying in Nelson's death penalty phase was James, his older brother.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: An abusive childhood, parent neglect, and a bad divorce were some of things Scott Nelson had to deal with growing up. His defense brought in his older brother, James, to explain to the jury what Nelson went through years when he was growing up.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Cross-examination continued on the Defense's first witness during the penalty phase. James Nelson, Scott's older, brother explained what he went through as child and young teenager.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: For the first time in the penalty phase jurors heard from a mental health expert. After his arrest in the murder of Jennifer Fulford, Scott Nelson was evaluated by several doctors, which included a neuropsychologist.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors heard about the mental and physical health issues of the defendant.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Testimony took jurors back to the bar where Karen Read and her boyfriend, John O'Keefe were hanging out hours before he was killed. He would be found in the snow on the lawn of a retired Boston police sergeant.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: An ATF special agent testified for the State. But he wasn't there because of his job.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The state of Karen Read's intimate relationship with the victim, John O'Keefe, was crucial to the prosecution's case.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Text messages dominated this portion of the trial. Karen Read had been sending flirtatious messages to the witness on the stand, Brian Higgins.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The Defense grilled the man who she was flirting with in text messages. The jury was shown these texts between Karen Read and Brian Higgins weeks before John O'Keefe was killed.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury listened to what Brian Higgins was doing in the hours before John O'Keefe died.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Successful Atlanta entrepreneur Lance Herndon usually got what he wanted, but when he is found bludgeoned to death in his waterbed, it appeared he got more than he could handle, possibly due to a business deal gone wrong or a girlfriend's revenge.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: When an unknown assailant guns down sheriff-elect Derwin Brown shortly after winning his election, investigators suspect a political assassination, only to instead uncover an extensive trail of corruption.
